title: Brucellosis: Infectious Disease Overview
short_description: Clinical overview of brucellosis, a bacterial infectious disease affecting livestock that can be transmitted to humans.
long_description: This document provides a comprehensive overview of brucellosis, an infectious disease caused by bacteria from the genus Brucella. The text covers the epidemiology of the disease, noting its rarity in the United States but higher prevalence in other global regions. It details the four bacterial species responsible for infection and describes the clinical presentation, including both acute and chronic symptom patterns. The document outlines common symptoms such as fever, muscle pain, headache, appetite loss, profuse sweating, and physical weakness, while emphasizing the variable onset and duration of the disease if left untreated.
